Name: Libating god with the head of a falcon
Description: The striding falcon-headed god is holding a slender jar without handles out in front of him. He is wearing a short kilt and is standing on a rectangular base. In front of the god should be an offering stand with flowers or dishes onto which he pours the water. This is the eldest son or the funerary priest in the role of Horus, who is performing the funerary ceremonies for his father Osiris.This piece was presumably part of the tomb equipment, symbolizing an eternal libation for the benefit of the deceased.
